title: Cabrillo National Monument: Research
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Research               Research              With our team of scientists and resource managers, we work to preserve the unique ecosystems and diversity of plants and animals that call Cabrillo National Monument home. In collaboration with our partners at the US Navy, the US Geological Survey, the San Diego Natural History Museum, and local academic institutions, Cabrillo researchers diligently monitor both the terrestrial and aquatic biomes across the parks 166 acres and beyond. This information allows us to best manage these public lands, in the face of a rapidly changing global environment, for the enjoyment of many generations to come.         Learn more about research at Cabrillo National Monument by exploring the following areas: BioBlitz Current Studies Permitting
